summary: This is a brief email chain from August 2019 regarding contact information for a prison warden. The email suggests a Deputy Attorney General (DAG) may call the warden to thank him for 'stepping in' and to reiterate support.

persons.name: Ward Warden
persons.context: The Acting Ward Warden is the subject of the email; their private line and work cell numbers are being shared so a Deputy Attorney General can call to thank them.

persons.name: Regional Director Northeast Region 5
persons.context: This individual provided the contact information for the Acting Ward Warden as requested.

connections.description: The Regional Director is providing the Warden's contact information to another party, indicating a supervisory or administrative reporting line.

events.title: Request for Warden's Contact Information
events.description: A request was made for the Acting Ward Warden's private line and work cell number.

events.title: Planned Call from DAG to Warden
events.description: An email indicates the Deputy Attorney General (DAG) may call the Acting Ward Warden to thank him for 'stepping in' and to reiterate support.

keyFacts: The email is dated August 14, 2019, shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody on August 10, 2019.
It discusses a Deputy Attorney General (DAG) potentially calling an Acting Ward Warden to thank him for 'stepping in'.
The context suggests this communication is related to prison administration matters, possibly in the aftermath of a significant event.
Contact information (private line and work cell) for the warden is being shared among officials.
